paper_metadata.title: Carrier screening program for BRCA1/BRCA2 pathogenic variants among Ashkenazi Jewish women in Israel: An observational study
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with increased risk for breast and ovarian cancer.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on population studies.
variants.additional_notes: This variant accounted for 53% of identified BRCA2 variants in the study.
key_quotes: The 3 known founder variants were the most common with the BRCA2 c.5946del variant being the most common (64, 53%)

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with increased risk for breast and ovarian cancer.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on limited cases.
variants.additional_notes: This variant was one of the additional variants identified in the screening.
